::: {.callout-tip}
## Tip for better analyzing the plots

All the graphs on this page are interactive, which means that
if you hover your cursor or mouse over the graph, you can see the temperature
for specific days.
:::

Lately, there has been a lot of talk about the climate, climate change,
and in Paraguay, about the heat or heat wave. With this material, I
would like to contribute some quantitative data through an exploratory
analysis. To this end, we will use the daily air temperature for
Asunción from January 2016 to December 2023. All data is free and I
obtained it from
[Visual Crossing](https://www.visualcrossing.com/).   
Although a somewhat more detailed exploratory analysis has been published
[elswhere](https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7178418255764537344/),
in this post, I would like to give a brief summary with a focus on
interactive graphics.


```{r}
#| eval: true
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| fig-align: left
#| out-width: 100%
#| fig-cap: Temperatura promedio diaria
#| label: fig-1

asu <- readRDS("asu.RDS") 
library(ggplot2)
p <- ggplot(data = asu, aes(x = datetime, y = temp)) + 
  geom_line() +
  geom_smooth(method = "loess", se = FALSE, colour = "red") +
  geom_hline(yintercept = mean(asu$temp), linetype = 2, color = "blue") +
  labs(y = "Daily temperature (°C)",
       x = "Date",
       title = "Average daily temperature for Asuncion (2016 - 2023)",
       subtitle = "Promedio de la temperatura diaria para Asuncion",
       caption = "Source: Schneider Consulting | Data: Visual Crossing") +
  theme(panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
        panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
  ) +
  theme_classic()

plotly::ggplotly(p)

#knitr::include_graphics("avg_daily_temp_asu.png")
```

Podemos observar en este grafico un promedio de la temperatura diaria alrededor
de 23°C y una clara tendencia al alza a partir del año 2022.   

En el siguiente grafico observamos la temperatura maxima diaria.

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| fig-align: left
#| out-width: 100%
#| fig-cap: Temperatura maxima diaria
#| label: fig-2

asu <- readRDS("asu.RDS") 
library(ggplot2)
p <- ggplot(data = asu, aes(x = datetime, y = tempmax)) + 
  geom_line() +
  geom_smooth(method = "loess", se = FALSE, colour = "red") +
  geom_hline(yintercept = mean(asu$tempmax), linetype = 2, color = "blue") +
  labs(y = "Daily max. temperature (°C)",
       x = "Date",
       title = "Daily max. temperature for Asuncion (2016 - 2023)",
       subtitle = "Temperatura maxima diaria para Asuncion",
       caption = "Source: Schneider Consulting | Data: Visual Crossing") +
  theme(panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
        panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
  ) +
  theme_classic()

plotly::ggplotly(p)
```

El promedio de la temperatura maxima diaria llega a 29.3°C. Tambien con una
tendencia al alza, pero no tan pronuciada.

Observemos con más detalle la sensacion termica diaria (máxima) en una
trama interactiva.

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| fig-align: left
#| out-width: 100%
#| fig-cap: Sensacion termica (max.) promedio diaria
#| label: fig-3

asu <- readRDS("asu.RDS") 
library(ggplot2)
p <- ggplot(data = asu, aes(x = datetime, y = feelslikemax)) + 
  geom_line() +
  geom_smooth(method = "loess", se = FALSE, colour = "red") +
  geom_hline(yintercept = mean(asu$feelslikemax), linetype = 2, color = "blue") +
  labs(y = "Max. temperature (°C)",
       x = "Date",
       title = "Daily feelslike max. temperature for Asuncion (2016 - 2023)",
       subtitle = "Temperatura max. de la sensacion termica diaria para Asuncion",
       caption = "Source: Schneider Consulting | Data: Visual Crossing") +
  theme(panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
        panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
  ) +
  theme_classic()


plotly::ggplotly(p)
```

Sin sorpresa, podemos observar el mismo patrón que en el grafico anterior. El
promedio de la sensacion termica (max.) se encuentra alrededor de los 31°C,
tambien con una tendencia al alza.
